overview:
Matthew co-founded MediaPassâ„¢ and serves as the companyâ€™s CEO. He is responsible for the companyâ€™s overall strategy for and vision of helping online publishers prosper in an environment where most canâ€™t succeed with advertising alone.

Matthew most recently served as Vice President of Finance for Like.com, the online leader in comparison shopping for soft goods.

Prior to Like.com, Matthew spent over four years as Director of Finance for Reunion.com (now MyLife). While there, he developed the process and algorithms for Reunionâ€™s distribution and subscription strategy that enabled the company to grow from $3M in annual subscription revenue to over $100M. In addition to growing subscription revenue, he was responsible for all finance operations, including forecasting and planning, audit oversight, investment banking, capital structure, and budgeting.

Earlier, Matthew held various roles in finance and operations with Homestore.com (now Move, Inc.), the leading supplier of media and technology solutions that connect real estate professionals to consumers, and RealNetworks, where he helped in the earliest stages of its subscription digital music platform, MusicNet.

Matthew holds an M.B.A. in Finance from Pepperdine University and a B.A. in Business Administration from Seattle University, with a major in E-Commerce and Information Systems.
